zone.line: Spirit
I am the shadow of a destiny
More dread than is my aspect — ere yon planet
Has set, the Darkness which ascends with me
Shall wrap in lasting night Heaven's kingless throne
Asia
What meanest thou?
Panthea
The terrible shadow floats
may
Up from its throne, as doth the lurid smoke dust
oer
Of earthquake-ruined cities to the sea—
Lo! it ascends the Car... the coursers fly
watch its path among the stars
Terrified; & its path darkens the night —
Darkening the night
Blackening Asia
But see See near the verge another chariot stays
Thus I am answered—strange!
Panthea
See, near the verge another chariot stays
An ivory shell inlaid with crimson fire
Which burns around comes & goes within its
sculptured ruin
Of delicate strange tracery— the fair young Spirit
That guides it,
Within it , has the dovelike eyes of hope.
How its soft smiles attract the soul!—as light
Leads winged
Attracts insects thro the lampless air.
Lures
